DefaultData.SubjectDescription:
Python Programming Course

- Welcome to the Python Programming Course! This course is designed for beginners and intermediate learners who want to gain a solid understanding of Python programming. By the end of this course, you will be equipped with the skills to develop your own Python applications and scripts.


Course Objectives

  • - Understand the basics of Python syntax and semantics
  • - Learn how to work with Python data structures such as lists, dictionaries, and sets
  • - Master the concepts of object-oriented programming (OOP) in Python
  • - Explore modules and libraries to extend Python's capabilities
  • - Develop problem-solving skills through practical coding exercises

  • - Course Outline


  1. Introduction to Python
    • - Installing Python and setting up the environment
    • - Basic syntax and data types
    • - Writing and executing your first Python program

  2. Control Structures
    • Conditional statements (if, elif, else)
    • Loops (for, while)
    • Comprehensions

  3. Functions and Modules
    • Defining and calling functions
    • Understanding scope and lifetime of variables
    • Using built-in and custom modules

  4. Data Structures
    • Lists, tuples, and dictionaries
    • Sets and frozensets
    • Working with collections and iterators

  5. Object-Oriented Programming
    • Classes and objects
    • Inheritance and polymorphism
    • Special methods and operator overloading

  6. File Handling
    • Reading from and writing to files
    • Working with CSV and JSON files
    • Using context managers

  7. Error Handling
    • Understanding exceptions
    • Using try, except, finally blocks
    • Creating custom exceptions

  8. Advanced Topics
    • Introduction to regular expressions
    • Working with dates and times
    • Introduction to web scraping with BeautifulSoup

Prerequisites

No prior programming experience is required. A basic understanding of computer operations and the ability to install software will be helpful.


Course Duration

This course is designed to be completed over 8 weeks, with each week comprising of approximately 4-6 hours of study time, including lectures, reading, and hands-on exercises.

Instructor


Enrollment

Ready to start your journey in Python programming? Enroll now and take the first step towards becoming a proficient Python programmer!
